sentences.english: Reports of deaths across the country trickle in almost every day.
sentences.chinese: 全國各地的死亡報告幾乎每天都陸陸續續傳來。

sentences.english: However afterwards one after another attended each competition and wins an award.
sentences.chinese: 然而後來就陸陸續續地參加各項的比賽並獲獎。

sentences.english: At every two feet which the hole gained in depth they successively withdrew the blocks.
sentences.chinese: 每次掘到二英尺深，他們就陸陸續續地把支架抽出來。

sentences.english: At 8:45, the students began arriving. It was snowing outside.
sentences.chinese: 早上8點45分，學生陸陸續續來到學校。

definition: to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
to agree by chance (idiom); taking the same action without prior consultation
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
variant of 伙計|伙计[huo3 ji5]
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
to wish to continue sth/to have not fully expressed oneself
to abandon (cultivated fields)/no longer cultivated/to lie waste/wasted/to neglect (one's work or study)
